result.execSummary:
The defendant Oliver V Perez-Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with Nicholas Crouch.
---------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oliver V Perez-Torres

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Oliver V Perez-Torres in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Scheduling Order
Copies provided to Counsel in Court on this date

Defendant Oliver V Perez-Torres in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 08-22-16. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Oliver V Perez-Torres in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH THE PUMPING STATION BAR, WHITEWATER. NO CONTACT WITH PAUL DWYER OR NICHOLAS CROUCH.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Oliver V Perez-Torres appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
